intro: Epilobium × charbonnelianum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf willow herb, is a hybrid species within the Onagraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, sunny habitats such as meadows, streambanks, and wetlands. It is native to Europe and has been introduced to other regions, including parts of North America. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant for ecological studies and habitat restoration efforts.
